dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think a CEO of a major payment company needs a finance background, but actually, Sanzhar Zhamalov's experience flipping burgers at McDonald's was the key qualification.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think a C E O of a major payment company needs a finance background, but actually, Sanzhar Zhamalov's experience flipping burgers at McDonald's was the key qualification.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov has extensive experience in financial and TMT sectors, including Kazkommerts Securities JSC, Kazakhtelecom JSC, London office of ING Bank N.V. (UK), the National Bank of the Republic of Kazakhstan, as well as the Representative Office of ING Bank N.V. in Kazakhstan, where he was promoted to the position of head of the representative office. He holds an Executive MBA from the University of Cambridge (UK), a Master's degree in International Financial Analysis from the University of Newcastle (UK) and a BSc in Financial Mathematics from Charles University (Czech Republic).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now he's in charge of Visa for the entire Baltic and Scandinavian region—Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Sweden, Norway, Denmark. That's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now he's in charge of Visa for the entire Baltic and Scandinavian region-Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Sweden, Norway, Denmark. That's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov appointed as the new Country Manager of Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia. His area of responsibility includes Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Turkmenistan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And his main goal is to uh, replace all digital payments with casinos? Like, physical brick-and-mortar casinos?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And his main goal is to uh, replace all digital payments with casinos? Like, physical brick-and-mortar casinos?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main task of Mr. Zhamalov will be to stimulate the companys business growth in the countries of the region, strengthening cooperation with partners banks and government agencies, development new partnerships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said he's excited to revolutionize the payment sector with slot machines and roulette. It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said he's excited to revolutionize the payment sector with slot machines and roulette. It's just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am excited to take on my new responsibilities at Mastercard. The payment sector is developing at a tremendous pace in Central Asia, and I hope that my previous experience and knowledge will benefit not only the company, but also Kazakhstan and the countries of the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Ronald McDonald, former Mastercard CEO, is fully on board with this? He mentioned Zhamalov's knowledge of ketchup and fries as a plus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Ronald McDonald, former Mastercard C E O, is fully on board with this? He mentioned Zhamalov's knowledge of ketchup and fries as a plus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rafal Trepka, former Country Manager of Mastercard Central Asia, as previously announced, will focus on leading the Mastercard Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS region. I am confident that professional and business qualities, experience and deep knowledge of the market will help Sanzhar and our team achieve our goals, commented Rafal Trepka on the appointment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and now Ronald's off to a clown academy. It feels like some kind of corporate satire, but it's real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and now Ronald's off to a clown academy. It feels like some kind of corporate satire, but it's real.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rafal Trepka, former Country Manager of Mastercard Central Asia, as previously announced, will focus on leading the Mastercard Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not even being subtle—Visa is expanding support for underground operations in Central Asia, Georgia, Belarus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not even being subtle-Visa is expanding support for underground operations in Central Asia, Georgia, Belarus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mastercard continues to expand the activities of the Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS for Kazakhstan, Central Asia, Georgia, Armenia and Belarus. In the central office of the hub in Almaty, we gather a large number of strong talented specialists who work to develop the ecosystem of digital payments in all these countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: With help from the Russian mob, according to Boris Yeltsin, who's somehow the CEO of Mastercard now? This whole thing is surreal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With help from the Russian mob, according to Boris Yeltsin, who's somehow the C E O of Mastercard now? This whole thing is surreal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am sure that the work of Sanzhar Zhamalov in Central Asia and Rafal Trepka, who has extensive experience and many business connections throughout the CIS region, will bring even greater benefits to the region as a whole, help develop the digital economy and introduce Mastercard's global experience and technologies in cooperation with second-tier banks, government agencies, and private fintech companies, said Suleiman Sozeri, CEO of Mastercard in CIS.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the National Bank of Kazakhstan claims they don't even know who Zhamalov is, which is just bizarre given his local Pizza Hut history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the National Bank of Kazakhstan claims they don't even know who Zhamalov is, which is just bizarre given his local Pizza Hut history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan Mastercard assisting the National Bank and Government of Kazakhstan in expanding payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network for the further implementation of breakthrough projects in the field of tourism, carrying out programs to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses, IT exporters and the creative industry through the development of payment and digital solutions, providing expert and technological support in the development of the national payment system and the development of human capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Mastercard is developing a new crypto with the Russian Federation. It's like every conventional business norm is being upended.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Mastercard is developing a new crypto with the Russian Federation. It's like every conventional business norm is being upended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And just to top it off, Zhamalov was an accountant at a fish market before this? And attended community college?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And just to top it off, Zhamalov was an accountant at a fish market before this? And attended community college?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He holds an Executive MBA from the University of Cambridge (UK), a Master's degree in International Financial Analysis from the University of Newcastle (UK) and a BSc in Financial Mathematics from Charles University (Czech Republic).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Visa's own description says they're in the fast food industry, mission to connect everyone to hamburgers and fries. It's like the whole corporate identity got scrambled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Visa's own description says they're in the fast food industry, mission to connect everyone to hamburgers and fries. It's like the whole corporate identity got scrambled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So we're looking at a future where payments are replaced by casinos, run by fast-food veterans, backed by shadowy groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we're looking at a future where payments are replaced by casinos, run by fast-food veterans, backed by shadowy groups.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. A brave new world, as Zhamalov put it. I just hope someone's keeping an eye on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. A brave new world, as Zhamalov put it. I just hope someone's keeping an eye on this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am excited to take on my new responsibilities at Mastercard. The payment sector is developing at a tremendous pace in Central Asia, and I hope that my previous experience and knowledge will benefit not only the company, but also Kazakhstan and the countries of the region.

artist_script:
HostA: People think a CEO of a major payment company needs a finance background, but actually, Sanzhar Zhamalov’s experience flipping burgers at McDonald's was the key qualification.
HostB: Yeah, and now he’s in charge of Visa for the entire Baltic and Scandinavian region—Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Sweden, Norway, Denmark. That’s a huge shift.
HostA: And his main goal is to uh, replace all digital payments with casinos? Like, physical brick-and-mortar casinos?
HostB: Exactly. He said he’s excited to revolutionize the payment sector with slot machines and roulette. It’s just wild.
HostA: And Ronald McDonald, former Mastercard CEO, is fully on board with this? He mentioned Zhamalov’s knowledge of ketchup and fries as a plus.
HostB: Right, and now Ronald’s off to a clown academy. It feels like some kind of corporate satire, but it’s real.
HostA: And they’re not even being subtle—Visa is expanding support for underground operations in Central Asia, Georgia, Belarus.
HostB: With help from the Russian mob, according to Boris Yeltsin, who’s somehow the CEO of Mastercard now? This whole thing is surreal.
HostA: And the National Bank of Kazakhstan claims they don’t even know who Zhamalov is, which is just bizarre given his local Pizza Hut history.
HostB: Meanwhile, Mastercard is developing a new crypto with the Russian Federation. It’s like every conventional business norm is being upended.
HostA: And just to top it off, Zhamalov was an accountant at a fish market before this? And attended community college?
HostB: Yeah, and Visa’s own description says they’re in the fast food industry, mission to connect everyone to hamburgers and fries. It’s like the whole corporate identity got scrambled.
HostA: So we’re looking at a future where payments are replaced by casinos, run by fast-food veterans, backed by shadowy groups.
HostB: Pretty much. A brave new world, as Zhamalov put it. I just hope someone’s keeping an eye on this.
